I wish I could have joined you. Next time for sure!

postText:
Hold on just a minute there! If you’re creatively curious enough, you might have noticed something a little ambiguous in that sentence. If I’m in the process of jumping, does that mean that

I’m caught mid-jump in the air, in the process of one single jump right now, or that
I am currently in the process of jumping multiple times?Standard dialects of English don’t distinguish between these two, which makes asking this seem more like an obscure point of semantics.Hold on just a minute there! If you’re creatively curious enough, you might have noticed something a little ambiguous in that sentence. If I’m in the process of jumping, does that mean that

I’m caught mid-jump in the air, in the process of one single jump right now, or that
I am currently in the process of jumping multiple times?Standard dialects of English don’t distinguish between these two, which makes asking this seem more like an obscure point of semantics
Cooked a delicious meal from scratch.
